article.title: Cladistic analysis of Abracrini genera (Orthoptera, Acrididae, Ommatolampinae)
article.abstract: A cladistic analysis using 50 characters and 21 genera of the Neotropical tribe Abracrini was performed in order to test the monophyly of the tribe and to reconstruct a phylogenetic hypothesis. Abracrini is supported by three synapomorphies: penultimate article of maxillary palps unflattened; second segment of hind tarsi short and internal apophysis of cerci vestigial. The analysis demonstrates that Abracrini is a monophyletic tribe, as well as a relationship among its genera was (Psiloscirtus splendidus (((Parasitalces sexnotata + Sitalces volxemi) (Arimacris trinitatis (Caruaruacris bivittatus + Salvadoracris nigritus))) (((Eusitalces vittatus + Liebermannacris dorsualis) (Monneacris fascipes (Robustusacris balzapambae (Xiphiola borellii (Eujivarus fusiformis + Roppacris griseipes))))) (((Omalotettix obliquus + Orthoscapheus coryaceus) (Abracris dilecta + Jodacris ferruginea)) (Teinophaus saussurei (Rhachicreagra nothra (Agesander ruficornis + Ixalotettix compactus))))))). Further data on biogeography and a distribution map are provided.

article.title: Type specimens of Chrysomelidae (Coleoptera) in the Academy of Natural Sciences in Philadelphia
article.abstract: Type specimens of 88 species of Chrysomelidae are housed in the Academy of Natural History of Philadelphia collection5 holotypes, 60 syntypes, 13 paratypes, and 10 paralectotypes.

article.title: Scale insects (Hemiptera: Sternorrhyncha: Coccoidea) of the Krakatau Islands including species from adjacent Java
article.abstract: In this paper we provide a list of all species of scale insects that have been collected in the Krakatau Islands since the catastrophic eruption of 1883. Included in the list are species collected during the La Trobe University Expedition in 1984 from the islands and from the adjacent mainland in Java and also species collected in earlier expeditions, including those during 1919–1933, discussed by Dammerman (1948). In addition, we describe two new species of armoured scales, Aulacaspis thorntoni Williams & Miller and Greeniella calophylli Williams & Miller and provide a key to the species of Greeniella Cockerell.

article.title: A description of a larva of Ancyrona diversa Pic, 1921 and its phylogenetic implications (Coleoptera: Trogossitidae)
article.abstract: A larva of Ancyrona diversa Pic, 1921 (Coleoptera: Trogossitidae) associated with adults is described in detail. Its morphological features are compared with known larvae of the tribe Lophocaterini and the subfamilies Trogossitinae and Peltinae. Phylogenetic and systematic implications are discussed. A resurrection of the subfamily name Lophocaterinae is suggested for the trogossitid tribes Decamerini, Lophocaterini and Ancyronini.

article.title: A taxonomic study of the genus Midoria Kato (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Ledrinae), with descriptions of two new species from China
article.abstract: The paper deals with eight species of the genus Midoria Kato, 1931 (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Ledrinae), including three new combinations and two new species, Midoria emmrichi (Zhang et al, 2004) comb. nov., Midoria longicornis (Zhang et al, 2004) comb. nov., Midoria funebris (Jacobi, 1944) comb. nov., Midoria huapingensis sp. nov. and Midoria lamellata sp. nov.. A key to distinguish all species of the genus (except Midoria capitata Kato) is given, and illustrations of genitalia are provided. The type specimens of new species are deposited in the Institute of Entomology, Guizhou University (GUGC).
